poem:
### In Memory's Shadow

Looming trails of justice,  
gavel echoes through the years—  
in Northern winds, the sighs of  
forgotten cries and whispered names.  
In court's cold embrace,  
stones whisper to the gorse,  
while ghosts of a bruised land  
linger in shadows of a prosecutor's  
determined stride. Silence condemns,  
yet peace is a trembling leaf.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
